marketNews.title: BI Rate Cut 25 Bps to 4.75%, Outside Expectations
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (17/9) cut the BI Rate by 25 basis points to 4.75%, outside the consensus expectation that it would remain unchanged. The lending facility was also cut by 25 bps to 5.5%, while the deposit facility was cut by 50 bps to 3.75%. With this decision, the BI Rate has fallen 125 bps since the beginning of 2025.

Governor Perry Warjiyo said the decision aims to boost economic growth while maintaining exchange rate stability and inflation in the 1.5-3.5% range for 2025 and 2026. He added that the cut also reflects the high probability of a Federal Reserve rate cut at the Wednesday meeting (17/9 local time) and a stable but weakening US dollar index (DXY). Perry emphasized that the authorities welcome the government's expansionary fiscal policy, including the placement of a 200 trillion rupiah government cash reserve in state-owned banks (Himbara), reflecting an "all-out pro-growth" stance by both state institutions.

The rate cut comes amid parliamentary discussions to expand the Bank Indonesia mandate and to give the DPR authority to recommend the dismissal of the Bank Indonesia governor, as outlined in a draft law amending Law No.4/2023 on Financial Sector Development (P2SK).

Kontan reported that the expanded mandate would include "creating a conducive economic environment for real-sector growth and job creation." Currently, the BI mandate is limited to stabilising the rupiah, preserving payment system stability, and supporting financial system stability to foster sustainable economic growth.

The new provision allowing the DPR to recommend the removal of a governor could raise concerns about BI independence, according to Bloomberg. The concern resurfaced after BI and the government signed a new burden-sharing agreement.

Following the rate cut, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose 0.85% to an all-time high of 8,025 on the day, while the 10-year government bond yield fell 5 bps and the rupiah remained modestly stronger at +0.06%.

Key Takeaway

We assess that the BI decision to further cut rates signals a clear priority on economic recovery, especially after the announcement of the third stimulus package in 2025 and liquidity injection to Himbara by the government. We also note the larger cut to the deposit facility compared with the BI Rate. The deposit facility rate, an overnight rate paid by BI on surplus funds placed by commercial banks, influences overnight interbank loan rates. The larger cut is expected to encourage banks to lend surplus funds as credit rather than placing them with the central bank. This initiative considers the slow transmission of the BI Rate cut, as BI reports that bank loan and deposit rates have only fallen 7 bps and 16 bps respectively since the start of the year up to August 2025.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia reported that bank credit growth reached +7.56% YoY for the first eight months of 2025 (vs. +7.03% YoY for the first seven months of 2025, and +11.4% YoY for the same period in 2024), lower than the 2025 target downgraded by BI to the +8-11% YoY range. Investment credit grew +13.86% YoY in the first eight months, while consumption credit grew +7.89% YoY and working-capital credit grew +3.53% YoY. On the funding side, third-party funds grew +8.51% YoY, and the loan-to-deposit ratio stood at 86.03%.

President Prabowo Subianto reshuffled the Red-White Cabinet on Wednesday (17/9), moving Erick Thohir from the BUMN minister to the Youth and Sports minister and appointing Djamari Chaniago as the Coordinating Minister for Political and Security Affairs. State Secretary Prasetyo Hadi said the government has not yet appointed a definitive replacement for the BUMN minister.

The National Nutrition Agency announced on Tuesday (16/9) that the government plans to expand the Free Nutritious Meal program to teachers and posyandu volunteers, which currently only targets children, pregnant women, and nursing mothers.

The US Census Bureau recorded that US retail sales grew +0.6% MoM in August, beating consensus expectations of +0.2% MoM. Year-over-year, US retail sales rose +5% in August 2025 (vs. +4.1% YoY in July 2025). Reuters reported that despite the sales increase, economists expect the Fed to continue cutting rates at the Wednesday meeting (17/9) as the US labor market weakens.

Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto told Reuters on Wednesday (17/9) that the free trade agreement with the European Union (IEU-CEPA) will be signed in Bali on 23 September 2025. The statement followed a Financial Times report that EU Trade Commissioner Maros Šefčovič will visit Indonesia to sign the deal. Earlier, in June 2025, Airlangga said the agreement would grant Indonesia zero tariffs on almost 80% of its export products to the EU and remove non-tariff barriers, hoping the EU would expedite ratification so the agreement could be effective by the end of 2026 or 2027.

Techno9 Indonesia (NINE) announced that Poh Holdings Pte. Ltd. has acquired approximately 773.4 million (35.85%) NINE shares from the controlling shareholder Heddy Kandou. About 413.3 million (19.16%) of the shares were purchased at roughly 12.2 rupiah per share, lower than the original agreement price of 19 rupiah per share, due to certain debt and liabilities assumed by the company. After completion, Poh Holdings will become the new controlling shareholder and will conduct a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: EMAS Sets IPO Price at Rp2,880 per Share
tickerNews.content: $EMAS: Merdeka Copper Gold ($MDKA) subsidiary sets the IPO price at 2,880 rupiah per share. In this IPO, EMAS will offer approximately 1.6 billion (10%) new shares, implying a target fund raise of about 4.66 trillion rupiah with a market cap around 46.6 trillion rupiah. The public offering is scheduled for 17-19 September 2025 and listing on 23 September 2025.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Announces Acquisition of PSC Sakakemang and South Sakakemang, Increases Stake in TGI to 40%
tickerNews.content: $MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional announced it will acquire a 45% participation right as operator in PSC Sakakemang and an 80% participation right as operator in South Sakakemang in South Sumatra, Indonesia. The transaction will be effective after government approval. PSC Sakakemang has already received a development plan approval from the Indonesian government and borders directly with the PSC Corridor operated by MEDC. In a separate transaction, MEDC also increased its ownership in PT Transportasi Gas Indonesia (TGI) to 40%. TGI transports natural gas from the PSC Corridor and other suppliers in South Sumatra-Jambi to buyers in Riau, Batam, and Singapore. CEO Roberto Lorato said the total acquisition is valued at approximately 90 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: ADMR Announces Aluminum Smelter to Start Operations in 4Q25 with Initial Capacity 500,000 Tons
tickerNews.content: $ADMR: Alamtri Minerals Indonesia stated that the aluminium smelter built by the company through its subsidiary PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry will start phased operations in 4Q25 with an initial capacity of 500,000 tonnes of aluminium ingot per year. The smelter capacity will be gradually increased to 1.5 million tonnes per year.

tickerNews.title: UBS Group AG Sells Approximately 105 Million BUMI Shares at Rp108 per Share
tickerNews.content: $BUMI: UBS Group AG announced it has sold about 105 million Bumi Resources shares on 11 September 2025 at a price of roughly 108 rupiah per share, amounting to a total of about 11 billion rupiah. After this transaction, UBS Group AG's ownership in BUMI fell from 7.02% to 6.99%. UBS explained that the transaction was intended for client derivative hedging activities.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Shareholders Approve Changes to Board of Directors and Commissioners
tickerNews.content: $TLKM: Shareholders of Telkom Indonesia on Tuesday (16/9) approved changes to the board of directors and commissioners. The position of deputy president director, previously held by Muhammad Awaluddin, was eliminated. A new position of legal and compliance director was created and will be filled by Andy Kelana. TLKM also removed one commissioner position held by Ismail and appointed Ira Noviarti as an independent commissioner, who previously served as the president director at Unilever Indonesia ($UNVR) during 2020-2024.

tickerNews.title: OLIV Announces Divestiture of 77.9% Shares to Non-Affiliate Parties
tickerNews.content: $OLIV: Oscar Mitra Sukses Sejahtera announced that the controlling shareholders Hendro Jap and Hioe Mie Tjen have signed an agreement to divest 77.9% of OLIV shares to non-affiliated parties consisting of PT Olive Power Invest, PT Motif Investasi Indonesia, and PT Pacific Prima Permata. The transaction value was not disclosed. The transaction will be carried out in two stages, with the first stage scheduled for 18 September 2025.
